title: Brooch, ca. 1898
provenance: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor, Annie Schermerhorn Kane, and various donors
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Susan Dwight Bliss, Annie Schermerhorn Kane, and various donors
description: Gold brooch with oval carved sapphire cameo of Cybelle or Isis ( or the Personification of Italy) seated on throne; framed by four cabochon sapphires, ninety-three Old Mine diamonds, and pendant with sapphire drop weighing approximately 13.5 carats in gold mounting with three ruby chips and three emerald chips.

exhibitions.title: Ted Muehling Selects: Lobmeyr Glass from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Brooch, ca. 1898.
ca. 1898. Gold , sapphires, diamonds, rubies, emeralds. Museum purchase through gift of Susan Dwight Bliss, Annie Schermerhorn Kane, and various donors. 1969-40-46.
